decks.notes: The main concept of this Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large mana advantage, allowing for the quick deployment of powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator, Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, and Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to control the opponent's board and hand, while utilizing cards like Expedition Map and Relic of Progenitus for additional utility and card advantage.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans with a variety of counterspells, hand disruption spells, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the game by countering threats, removing key creatures, and disrupting the opponent's hand to prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. Additionally, the deck includes some powerful win conditions like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays by deploying powerful creatures and utilizing burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards that provide flexibility in combat situations, such as Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature aggression and direct damage spells, while also utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer for card advantage and additional threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan, allowing for consistent plays each turn.

The main idea of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief, along with other supporting cards such as Walking Ballista and Agatha's Soul Cauldron. The deck focuses on building up your board presence and utilizing various tools like Urza's Saga and Green Sun's Zenith to assemble the combo pieces quickly. By combining these cards effectively, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory through a well-timed and efficient combo strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays by utilizing artifact creatures and affinity cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to generate mana efficiently with cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, while also drawing cards with Thoughtcast and Thought Monitor. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Urza's Saga is a key card in the deck, allowing for the efficient tutoring of important artifacts like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to increase the damage output of the creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifact creatures and generating value through card draw and mana acceleration. By using cards like Thoughtcast, Springleaf Drum, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive board presence. The inclusion of counterspells like Metallic Rebuke and disruption tools like Soul-Guide Lantern and Tormod's Crypt helps to control the game and protect the deck's key threats. Overall, the deck emphasizes speed, efficiency, and synergy within the Affinity archetype to secure a swift victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Guide of Souls to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to close out games quickly with efficient attacking creatures and burn spells, backed up by some disruption and card advantage engines like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer. The key is to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand quickly and unexpectedly. The deck also includes various components to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Force of Negation and Thoughtseize. With cards like Solitude for removal and Ephemerate for additional value, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive plays. The deck's strategy hinges on efficient reanimation and control elements to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck revolves around a combo strategy that can be executed without needing to rely on lands. It focuses on quickly assembling specific cards to create a powerful win condition. By disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble all the pieces needed to activate Goblin Charbelcher and deal massive damage to the opponent. With a mix of card draw, tutors, and defensive spells, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones using cards like Persist and Ephemerate. The deck also includes control elements like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The combo aspect of the deck lies in the ability to set up graveyard interactions with cards like Faithful Mending and Thought Scour to enable your reanimation spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while maintaining control over the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and powerful enchantments to quickly overwhelm opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on maximizing damage output through cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Territorial Kavu, while also using Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding for additional support. This Aggro deck aims to control the battlefield with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while also including disruptive spells like Stubborn Denial and Lightning Bolt for added versatility and strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo by utilizing the abilities of cards like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Grove of the Burnwillows to cast these powerful creatures and control the board with Malevolent Rumble and Sowing Mycospawn. The deck also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to search for key pieces of the combo, while Blade of the Bloodchief provides additional value. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using the Amulet of Vigor to take advantage of Primeval Titan and Urza's Saga to search for key lands and combo pieces. By utilizing lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate extra mana, the deck can set up explosive turns where it can either overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Primeval Titan or win the game outright with a Scapeshift combo to deal lethal damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The key is to efficiently tutor for the right pieces and set up strong board positions to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo by utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Summoner's Pact to bring out Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck includes cards like Planar Genesis and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect the combo and generate additional advantages. The inclusion of creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and other support spells like Pact of Negation and Consign to Memory ensures the deck has a well-rounded strategy for success in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures like Allosaurus Rider to quickly and efficiently search for and play powerful combo pieces like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. Cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform help tutor for specific creatures, while Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer provide protection and disruption against opponents. The deck aims to create explosive plays by utilizing the synergy between different creatures and spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The key concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a board presence of artifact creatures, utilizing cards like Memnite and Ornithopter, and then pump them up with cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear for powerful attacks. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact support, while Metallic Rebuke offers disruption for opponent's plays. Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast help with card draw to keep the aggression going. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of cheap, efficient creatures backed up by artifact synergy and card advantage.
